skill.summary: Generates professional infographics with 20 layout types and 17 visual styles. Analyzes content, recommends layout√óstyle combinations, and generates publication-ready infographics.
skill.author: jimliu

security_audit.summary: All 239 static findings are false positives. The skill is a documentation-based prompt generator with no executable code. Detected patterns (backtick execution, weak crypto, system reconnaissance) are bash command examples in Markdown documentation, not actual code execution. No network, file execution, or malicious behavior found.

medium_findings.title: Bash Command Examples in Documentation
medium_findings.description: Static scanner detected bash backtick syntax in Markdown files. These are legitimate documentation examples showing EXTEND.md configuration lookup commands, not actual code execution.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Evidence confirms these are documentation examples, not executable code. The skill contains no TypeScript scripts that would actually run these commands.

low_findings.title: Documentation Code Blocks
low_findings.description: Multiple code blocks in Markdown files show bash command syntax. These are documentation for skill configuration and do not execute.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Documentation-only content. No TypeScript scripts exist in this skill that would execute these patterns.

content.value_statement: Transforms complex content into visually engaging infographics with 20 layout types and 17 visual styles. Analyzes content, recommends optimal layout√óstyle combinations, and generates prompts for publication-ready infographic images.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes input content to identify topic, data type, complexity, tone, and audience
Recommends optimal layout√óstyle combinations based on content structure and purpose
Generates structured content templates with headlines, labels, and visual elements
Creates detailed image generation prompts combining layout definitions and visual styles
Supports 20 layout types: timeline, comparison, hierarchy, cycles, and more
Supports 17 visual styles: craft-handmade, technical-schematic, corporate-memphis, and more
limitations: Does not generate images directly; delegates to image generation skills
Requires an available image generation skill to produce final output
Output quality depends on the underlying image generation skill
Text-heavy content may require multiple iterations for optimal visual balance

use_cases.title: Create Educational Infographics
use_cases.description: Transform educational content into visual learning materials with appropriate layouts for timelines, processes, and hierarchical concepts.

use_cases.title: Design Data Visualization
use_cases.description: Convert data-driven content into visual formats including comparison matrices, dashboards, and periodic-table style layouts.

use_cases.title: Generate Marketing Visuals
use_cases.description: Create engaging visual content for social media, presentations, and communications with styles suited to brand messaging.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Content Infographic
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate an infographic using default layout (bento-grid) and style (craft-handmade)

prompt_templates.title: Custom Layout and Style
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate an infographic with specific layout and visual style

prompt_templates.title: Social Media Format
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a vertical-format infographic optimized for social media platforms

prompt_templates.title: Multilingual Content
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate an infographic with Chinese text and appropriate cultural design considerations

output_examples.input: Introduction to Machine Learning with key concepts, algorithms, and applications
Climate change data: causes, effects, and solutions over time

best_practices: Provide clear, well-structured source content with distinct sections and key data points
Specify the intended audience and purpose to help the skill recommend optimal layouts
Use the --layout and --style options to guide the visual direction when you have preferences
anti_patterns: Avoid providing overly long content without clear structure; break into sections for better results
Do not expect the skill to interpret ambiguous or contradictory design instructions
Avoid using the skill for pure text generation without visual content requirements

faq.question: What layouts are best for comparing two options?
faq.answer: Use the binary-comparison layout with corporate-memphis or bold-graphic style for A vs B comparisons, pros-cons, or before-after scenarios.

faq.question: Can I create infographics in languages other than English?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --lang flag to specify language. The skill supports en, zh, ja, and other languages with appropriate text handling.

faq.question: What aspect ratios are supported?
faq.answer: Three options: landscape (16:9) for presentations, portrait (9:16) for social media, and square (1:1) for feed posts.

faq.question: How does the skill choose layout and style?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes content structure and purpose, then recommends combinations based on 12 pre-defined patterns. You can also specify --layout and --style directly.

faq.question: Does baoyu-infographic generate images directly?
faq.answer: No, it generates detailed prompts and delegates image generation to available image generation skills like baoyu-danger-gemini-web.

faq.question: What visual styles work best for technical content?
faq.answer: Technical-schematic and ikea-manual styles work well for technical documentation, while ui-wireframe suits interface documentation.
